alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 11:59AM EDT until July 28 at 10:17PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Breathitt, Lee, Magoffin and Owsley. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1158 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Breathitt county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackson, Beattyville, Booneville, Simpson, Fivemile, Frozen Creek, Keck, Elkatawa, Sewell, Inverness, Vancleve, Gentry, Noctor, Dumont, Wilhurst, Quicksand, Lawson, Yeadon, Taulbee and Portsmouth.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
